TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen of NORP origin , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON ( GPE ) . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant served in ORG and in DATE retired from service . His military pension was assessed to PERCENT of his average wage , according to his rank and DATE of service and was paid from ORG . The payments terminated in DATE , following the dissolution of GPE .
CARDINAL separate proceedings took place , in respect of the decrease in the applicant ’s military pension .

Firstly , on DATE , ORG , ORG , assessed the applicant ’s pension , as from DATE , at CARDINAL MONEY of the amount he had received until DATE . The applicant appealed against that decision and , after his appeal was dismissed , instituted administrative proceedings with ORG , which dismissed the applicant ’s claim on DATE .
On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint .

Secondly , the applicant lodged a constitutional claim challenging the constitutionality of the LAW incorporating into NORP law the former federal law regulating the pension insurance for military personnel ( the Yugoslav Military Pensions Act ) enacted in DATE and altered several times in DATE and DATE . On DATE ORG terminated those proceedings due to the enactment of new laws regulating the same matter .
